00033 #ifndef PIPESEGMENT_H
00034 #define PIPESEGMENT_H
00035 
00036 //STL Headers
00037 #include <vector>
00038 
00039 //GATS POC Headers
00040 #include "IPipeSegment.h"
00041 
00042 namespace PipeLineProcessing
00043 {
00044 
00045 template<class OutputPipeType>
00046 class PipeSegment : public PipeLineProcessing::IPipeSegment<OutputPipeType>
00047 {
00048 
00049 protected:
00050         /*  The following static data-members are included to force the user(s) of this
00051          *  class to adhere to the following rule:
00052          *              ALL PIPE SEGMENTS MUST IMPLEMENT AT LEAST THE IPIPESEGMENTBASE INTERFACE
00053          *  This method of compile-time detection of illegal template parameter types
00054          *  was pilfered from the following article/website:
00055          *              http://www.accu-usa.org/2000-09.html
00056         */
00057         const static IPipeSegmentBase* const OutputPipeType_Substitutable;
00058                 //examine end-of-file for details
00059         const static unsigned int OutputPipeType_Not_Void = (unsigned int)sizeof(OutputPipeType);
00060                 //illegal if OutputPipeSegmentType is void
00061 
00062         /* @brief These data structures are used to hold the output handlers */
00063         std::vector<IPipeSegmentBase *> theOutput;
00064 
00065         /* @brief Method to add an output handler to the collection of output handlers - inherited from IPipeSegmentBase */
00066         virtual bool addOutputHandler(IPipeSegmentBase *output)
00067                 { if (output == NULL || output == this) return false;   //we can't output to ourselves (infinite recursion), or output to NULL!
00068                   for (int i=0; i < (int)theOutput.size(); i++) {
00069                         if(theOutput[i] == output) return true; //The output handler is already registered with us!
00070                   }
00071                   theOutput.push_back(output);
00072                   return true;  //The output handler has been added.
00073                 };
00074 
00075         /* @brief Method to remove an output handler from the collection of output handlers - inherited from IPipeSegmentBase */
00076         virtual bool removeOutputHandler(IPipeSegmentBase *output)
00077                 { for (int i=0; i < (int)theOutput.size(); i++) {
00078                         if (theOutput[i] == output) {
00079                                 theOutput.erase((theOutput.begin() + i));
00080                                 return true;    //it was found, and has been removed.
00081                         }
00082                   }
00083                   return true; //it was never there to begin with, so it's already removed!
00084                 };
00085 
00086         /* @brief Method to remove all output handlers from the collection of output handlers - inherited from IPipeSegmentBase */
00087         virtual bool removeAllOutputHandlers()
00088                 { theOutput.clear(); //all done!
00089                   return true; //no failure conditions here!
00090                 };
00091 
00092 public:
00093         PipeSegment() {};
00094 
00095         /* @brief Method to connectTo and send output to another object - inherited from IPipeSegment */
00096         virtual IPipeSegment<OutputPipeType> *connectTo(OutputPipeType *output)
00097                 { addOutputHandler(output); return this; };
00098 
00099         /* @brief Method to disconnectFrom another object - inherited from IPipeSegment */
00100         virtual IPipeSegment<OutputPipeType> *disconnectFrom(OutputPipeType *output)
00101                 { removeOutputHandler(output); return this; };
00102 
00103         /* @brief Method to disconnectFrom all other objects - inherited from IPipeSegment */
00104         virtual void disconnectFromAll()
00105                 { removeAllOutputHandlers(); };
00106 
00107         /* @brief Shortened notation for connectTo and sending output to another object - inherited from IPipeSegment */
00108         virtual void operator+=(OutputPipeType *output)
00109                 { addOutputHandler(output); };
00110 
00111         /* @brief Shortened notation for disconnectFrom another object - inherited from IPipeSegment */
00112         virtual void operator-=(OutputPipeType *output)
00113                 { removeOutputHandler(output); };
00114 
00115         /* @brief Shortened notation for connectTo and sending output to another object - inherited from IPipeSegment */
00116         virtual void operator+=(OutputPipeType &output)
00117                 { addOutputHandler(&output); };
00118 
00119         /* @brief Shortened notation for disconnectFrom another object - inherited from IPipeSegment */
00120         virtual void operator-=(OutputPipeType &output)
00121                 { removeOutputHandler(&output); };
00122 
00123         virtual ~PipeSegment() {};
00124 };
00125 
00126 //This line does a compile-time check that the OutputPipeSegmentType template parameter
00127 //is an IPipeSegmentBase type.  It performs this check by attempting to cast a pointer
00128 //to an OutputPipeSegmentType as a pointer to an IPipeSegmentBase.  If you are very
00129 //clever you will realize that this would not fail with an OutputPipeSegmentType template
00130 //parameter of 'void'.  This is checked inline by the OutputPipeSegmentType_Not_Void static
00131 //data member in the PipeSegment class header file.
00132 template<class OutputPipeType>
00133 const IPipeSegmentBase* const PipeSegment<OutputPipeType>::OutputPipeType_Substitutable = (const OutputPipeType*) 0;
00134 
00135 
00136 }

00138 #endif /*PIPESEGMENT_H*/
